definition: to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: “So, did you bring the check?” Hu asks.
At the neck of the wrecked deck, the reckoner checked the opaque cheque.
sentences.chinese: 在遇險的甲板的脖子，計算者檢查不透明的支票。

sentences.english: The old-time thrill at receiving a publisher's check was gone.
sentences.chinese: 以前那種發表作品收到支票時的激動已經沒有了。

sentences.english: Send us a check today, do it now, so you will not forget.
sentences.chinese: 請於今日立即寄出支票，以免忘懷爲幸。

sentences.english: The rate for traveler 's cheque is 847 yuan against USD 100 .
sentences.chinese: 旅行支票的兌換率是100美元兌847元人民幣。

sentences.english: Certainly, sir. Would you like to open a time deposit savings account or a checking account?
sentences.chinese: 好的，先生。您想開定存儲蓄戶頭還是支票戶頭？

sentences.english: B: Here is a cheque for twenty thousand dollars for the deposit.
sentences.chinese: 這是訂金，二萬塊的支票。
你的支票被退票了，我沒拿到錢。

sentences.english: Payment is valid only after the cheque is cleared.
sentences.chinese: 支票付款須待支票收訖後才生效。

sentences.english: Payment is valid only after the cheque is cleared.
sentences.chinese: 支票付款須待支票收訖後才生效。

sentences.english: Can i please cash a check here?
sentences.chinese: 你能給我兌現一些旅行支票嗎？

sentences.english: She went post-haste to the bank and cashed the check .
sentences.chinese: 她急忙趕到銀行，把支票兌換成現金。
對不起，我們不接受支票。

sentences.english: I am enclosing a check for$125 as payment in full.
sentences.chinese: 茲附上一百二十五元支票一張作爲全部的付款。

sentences.english: Boss for a long time to negotiate with each other, finally got the cash a check.
sentences.chinese: 老闆與對方交涉很長時間後，終於拿到了現金支票。

sentences.english: He said Washington "will not provide a blank check."
sentences.chinese: 他說，華盛頓“不會給他們一張空白支票”。

definition: (in former times) banknote with a value in silver
paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
